seo.title: Ischia og Procida: utenfor Amalfikysten
seo.description: Termalbad, strender og ferjeruter fra Napoli/Sorrento.

intro: Combine Ischia's thermal spas with Procida's pastel harbours for a refreshing detour from the Amalfi Coast.

sections.title: Ischia highlights
body: Soak in thermal parks like Poseidon or Negombo; full-day passes range from €35–€45.
Climb Aragonese Castle for views across the bay and explore Sant'Angelo's pedestrian lanes.

sections.title: Procida highlights
body: Photograph Marina Corricella's pastel houses from Terra Murata and sample lingue di bue pastries.
Rent a scooter or e-bike to reach secluded beaches like Chiaiolella.

sections.title: Logistics & tickets
body: Take early ferries from Naples Beverello (one hour to Ischia, 35 minutes to Procida). A combined day trip is possible but better split over two days.
Buy return tickets in advance during summer weekends; last boats back to Naples leave around 21:30.

tips: Pack swimwear and a light towel even if you only plan to explore—thermal pools are irresistible after sightseeing.
Stay overnight on Ischia for relaxed evenings and to catch sunrise at the castle before day-trippers arrive.

faqs.q: Can I visit both islands in one day?
a: It's possible but rushed. Focus on one island per day or stay overnight to enjoy sunsets without ferry stress.

faqs.q: Do I need reservations for thermal parks?
a: Book ahead in high season (June–September). Weekdays are quieter, and some parks offer evening passes after 16:00 for lower prices.
